name: connect-wallet
code: const response = await connect(); console.log('Connected:' response.addresses.mainnet)
notes: Returns response with addresses object containing mainnet and testnet addresses

name: get-address
description: Get user's STX address after connecting
code: const response = await connect(); const mainnetAddress = response.addresses.mainnet; const testnetAddress = response.addresses.testnet
notes: Response contains both mainnet and testnet addresses

name: disconnect
code: await disconnect(); localStorage.removeItem('walletAddress')
notes: Disconnects wallet and clears session; also clear localStorage

name: stx-transfer
code: await makeSTXTokenTransfer({ recipient amount senderKey network anchorMode: AnchorMode.Any })
notes: Amount in microSTX (1 STX = 1000000 microSTX)

name: contract-call
code: await makeContractCall({ contractAddress contractName functionName functionArgs senderKey network anchorMode: AnchorMode.Any })
notes: Use cv.* constructors for functionArgs

name: deploy-contract
code: await makeContractDeploy({ contractName codeBody senderKey network anchorMode: AnchorMode.Any })
notes: codeBody is Clarity code as string

name: broadcast-tx
code: const txid = await broadcastTransaction(transaction network)
notes: Returns transaction ID

name: uint
code: uintCV(100)
notes: For uint function arguments

name: int
code: intCV(-100)
notes: For int function arguments

name: principal
code: principalCV('SP2J6ZY48GV1EZ5V2V5RB9MP66SW86PYKKQ9H6DPR')
notes: Standard or contract principal

name: string-ascii
code: stringAsciiCV('hello world')
notes: ASCII characters only

name: string-utf8
code: stringUtf8CV('hello 世界')
notes: Supports Unicode characters

name: buffer
code: bufferCV(Buffer.from('data'))
notes: Node.js Buffer or Uint8Array

name: tuple
code: tupleCV({ name: stringAsciiCV('test') value: uintCV(100) })
notes: Object with CV values

name: list
code: listCV([uintCV(1) uintCV(2) uintCV(3)])
notes: Array of CV values of same type

name: some
code: someCV(uintCV(100))
notes: Optional value present

name: none
code: noneCV()
notes: Optional value absent

name: ok-response
code: responseOkCV(uintCV(100))
notes: Success response

name: err-response
code: responseErrorCV(uintCV(404))
notes: Error response

name: get-balance
code: const response = await fetch(`https://api.hiro.so/extended/v1/address/${address}/balances`)
notes: Returns STX balance and all token balances

name: get-transactions
code: const response = await fetch(`https://api.hiro.so/extended/v1/address/${address}/transactions`)
notes: Paginated results with limit and offset

name: get-contract-info
code: const response = await fetch(`https://api.hiro.so/v2/contracts/interface/${address}/${contractName}`)
notes: Returns ABI and source code

name: call-read-only
code: const result = await callReadOnlyFunction({ contractAddress contractName functionName functionArgs senderAddress network })
notes: No transaction needed for read-only calls

name: get-transaction
code: const response = await fetch(`https://api.hiro.so/extended/v1/tx/${txid}`)
notes: Returns transaction details and status

name: mainnet
code: new StacksMainnet()
notes: Production network

name: testnet
code: new StacksTestnet()
notes: Testing network

name: devnet
code: new StacksDevnet()
notes: Local development

name: stx-postcondition
code: makeStandardSTXPostCondition(address FungibleConditionCode.Equal amount)
notes: Ensures exact STX amount transferred

name: ft-postcondition
code: makeStandardFungiblePostCondition(address FungibleConditionCode.Equal amount assetInfo)
notes: Ensures exact token amount transferred

name: nft-postcondition
code: makeStandardNonFungiblePostCondition(address NonFungibleConditionCode.Sends assetInfo tokenId)
notes: Ensures NFT ownership transfer

name: react-context-provider
description: Create React Context for wallet state with persistence
code: const Context = createContext(undefined); function Provider({ children }) { const [state setState] = useState(defaultState); useEffect(() => { localStorage.setItem(KEY JSON.stringify(state)) } [state]); return <Context.Provider value={state}>{children}</Context.Provider> }
notes: React-specific; includes localStorage persistence and hydration

name: sign-message
description: Sign message to prove wallet ownership
code: const { request } = await import('@stacks/connect'); const response = await request('stx_signMessage' { message: 'Sign to verify ownership' }); return { signature: response.signature publicKey: response.publicKey }
notes: Used for authentication without transfers; returns signature and publicKey

name: server-transaction
description: Build and broadcast transaction from server
code: const tx = await makeContractCall({ contractAddress contractName functionName functionArgs senderKey network nonce anchorMode: AnchorMode.Any }); const result = await broadcastTransaction({ transaction: tx network })
notes: Requires senderKey (private key) and nonce management

name: fetch-nonce
description: Get current nonce for server-side transactions
code: const response = await fetch(`https://api.hiro.so/extended/v1/address/${address}/nonces`); const data = await response.json(); return data.possible_next_nonce
notes: Essential for server-side transaction sequencing

name: wallet-sdk
description: Generate wallet from seed phrase for server-side transactions
code: const wallet = await generateWallet({ secretKey: seedPhrase password }); const account = generateNewAccount(wallet); const address = getStxAddress(account.accounts[0] networkKey)
notes: For server-side automation; keep seed phrases secure

name: complex-contract-call
description: Contract call with multiple arguments and types
code: const args = [stringUtf8CV(question) uintCV(BigInt(block)) bufferCV(hexToBuff(id)) intCV(BigInt(price)) tupleCV({ field: valueCV })]; await openContractCall(functionName args)
imports: import { stringUtf8CV uintCV bufferCV intCV tupleCV } from '@stacks/transactions'
notes: Shows proper type conversion for complex arguments

name: hex-to-buffer
description: Convert hex string to buffer for Clarity
code: function hexToBuff(hex) { const clean = hex.replace(/^0x/ ''); return Buffer.from(clean 'hex') }
notes: Essential for buffer arguments like feed IDs

name: fetch-readonly
code: const result = await fetchCallReadOnlyFunction({ contractAddress contractName functionName functionArgs: [uintCV(id)] network senderAddress }); const json = cvToJSON(result)
notes: No transaction fee; use for queries

name: unwrap-response
code: function unwrapResponseOk(cvJson) { if (cvJson.type === 'responseOk') return cvJson.value; if (cvJson.success) return cvJson.value; return null }
notes: Handles different response formats from cvToJSON

name: parse-cv-response
description: Parse and extract values from ClarityValue JSON
code: const json = cvToJSON(result); const ok = unwrapResponseOk(json); if (!ok) return null; const value = BigInt(ok.value)
notes: Common pattern for processing read-only responses

name: lazy-import
description: Lazy load Stacks.js to reduce bundle size
code: let modulePromise = null; async function getModule() { if (!modulePromise) modulePromise = import('@stacks/connect'); return modulePromise }
notes: Reduces initial bundle; cache promise for reuse

name: custom-fetch-network
description: Create network with custom fetch for headers
code: const customFetch = async (input init) => { const headers = { ...init?.headers 'x-hiro-api-key': key }; return fetch(input { ...init headers }) }; createNetwork({ network: 'mainnet' client: { baseUrl: url fetch: customFetch }})
notes: Useful for API key management and request customization

name: use-price-hook
description: React hook for fetching external price data
code: function useBtcPrice() { const [price setPrice] = useState(0); useEffect(() => { const fetchPrice = async () => { const res = await fetch(url); setPrice(await res.json()) }; fetchPrice(); const interval = setInterval(fetchPrice 60000); return () => clearInterval(interval) } []); return price }
notes: React-specific; shows interval cleanup pattern

name: parallel-reads
description: Execute multiple read-only calls in parallel
code: const promises = ids.map(id => fetchCallReadOnlyFunction({ contractAddress contractName functionName functionArgs: [uintCV(id)] network senderAddress })); const results = await Promise.all(promises)
notes: More efficient than sequential calls

name: contract-principal
code: const [address name] = contractId.split('.'); contractPrincipalCV(address name)
notes: For passing contract references as arguments

name: boolean-cv
description: Create boolean ClarityValue from JavaScript boolean
code: function boolCV(value) { return value ? trueCV() : falseCV() }
notes: Helper for converting JS boolean to Clarity

name: cv-to-hex
description: Encode ClarityValue to hex for request
code: const hexArgs = functionArgs.map(arg => cvToHex(arg))
notes: Used with request('stx_callContract') for Stacks Connect

name: parse-tuple-response
description: Parse tuple fields from read-only response
code: const json = cvToJSON(result); const ok = unwrapResponseOk(json); const fields = ok.value; return { name: fields.name.value count: BigInt(fields.count.value) }
notes: Common for contract data structures

name: env-network-config
code: const networkKey = process.env.NETWORK === 'mainnet' ? 'mainnet' : 'testnet'; const rpcUrl = process.env.RPC_URL || defaultRpc[networkKey]; const network = createNetwork({ network: networkKey client: { baseUrl: rpcUrl }})
notes: Standard pattern for multi-environment apps

name: post-condition-mode
code: await makeContractCall({ ...options postConditionMode: PostConditionMode.Allow })
notes: Allow or Deny; Allow skips post-condition validation

name: vanilla-state-persist
description: Persist wallet state with vanilla JavaScript (no React)
code: function saveWallet(data) { localStorage.setItem('wallet' JSON.stringify(data)) }; function loadWallet() { const raw = localStorage.getItem('wallet'); return raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : null }
notes: Framework-agnostic alternative to React Context; works in any JavaScript environment

name: poll-tx-status
description: Poll transaction status until confirmed or failed
code: async function pollTxStatus(txid) { while (true) { const res = await fetch(`https://api.hiro.so/extended/v1/tx/${txid}`); const tx = await res.json(); if (tx.tx_status === 'success' || tx.tx_status === 'abort_by_response') return tx; await new Promise(r => setTimeout(r 3000)) }}
notes: Polls every 3 seconds; returns when transaction confirms or fails

name: sequential-calls
description: Execute multiple contract calls in sequence
code: async function callSequence(calls network senderKey) { let nonce = await getNonce(address); for (const call of calls) { const tx = await makeContractCall({ ...call senderKey network nonce: nonce++ }); await broadcastTransaction({ transaction: tx network }) }}
notes: Manages nonce increments for sequential transactions

name: custom-tx-options
description: Override transaction fee and nonce manually
code: await makeContractCall({ contractAddress contractName functionName functionArgs senderKey network nonce: customNonce fee: BigInt(10000) anchorMode: AnchorMode.Any })
notes: Fee in microSTX; useful for batch transactions or custom nonce management

name: hiro-headers
description: Add randomized Hiro API headers for rate limiting
code: function getHiroHeaders() { const keys = ['key1' 'key2' 'key3']; const randomKey = keys[Math.floor(Math.random() * keys.length)]; return { 'x-hiro-api-key': randomKey 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }}
notes: Rotates API keys to distribute rate limits across multiple keys

name: format-balance
description: Format STX balance from microSTX to STX with decimals
code: function formatStx(microStx decimals = 6) { const stx = Number(microStx) / 1000000; return stx.toFixed(decimals) }
notes: 1 STX = 1,000,000 microSTX; default to 6 decimal places

name: tx-error-handling
description: Comprehensive error handling for transaction failures
code: try { const result = await broadcastTransaction(tx network); return result } catch (error) { if (error.message.includes('ConflictingNonceInMempool')) throw new Error('Nonce conflict wait and retry'); if (error.message.includes('NotEnoughFunds')) throw new Error('Insufficient balance'); throw error }
notes: Handles common transaction errors with user-friendly messages

name: switch-network
description: Dynamically switch between networks at runtime
code: function getNetwork(networkName) { const networks = { mainnet: new StacksMainnet() testnet: new StacksTestnet() devnet: new StacksDevnet() }; return networks[networkName] || networks.testnet }
notes: Factory pattern for network switching; defaults to testnet if unknown

name: connect-wallet-button
description: Wallet connect button with loading states
code: function ConnectButton({ onConnect }) { const [connecting setConnecting] = useState(false); const handleConnect = async () => { setConnecting(true); try { const response = await connect(); localStorage.setItem('walletAddress' response.addresses.mainnet); onConnect?.(response.addresses.mainnet); setConnecting(false) } catch(e) { setConnecting(false) }}; return <button onClick={handleConnect} disabled={connecting}>{connecting ? 'Connecting...' : 'Connect Wallet'}</button> }
imports: import { connect } from '@stacks/connect'; import { useState } from 'react'
notes: React component; uses new connect() API and saves address to localStorage

name: display-wallet-address
description: Display connected wallet with truncated address
code:
function WalletDisplay({ address }) { const truncated = address ? `${address.slice(0 6)}...${address.slice(-4)}` : ''; const handleCopy = () => navigator.clipboard.writeText(address); return
{truncated}
}
notes: Shows first 6 and last 4 characters; click to copy full address

name: use-wallet-hook
description: Complete React hook for wallet connection management
code: function useWallet() { const [address setAddress] = useState(null); const [connected setConnected] = useState(false); useEffect(() => { const saved = localStorage.getItem('walletAddress'); if (saved) { setAddress(saved); setConnected(true) }}, []); const connectWallet = async () => { const response = await connect(); const addr = response.addresses.mainnet; setAddress(addr); setConnected(true); localStorage.setItem('walletAddress' addr); return response }; const disconnectWallet = async () => { await disconnect(); setAddress(null); setConnected(false); localStorage.removeItem('walletAddress') }; return { address connected connect: connectWallet disconnect: disconnectWallet }}
imports: import { connect disconnect } from '@stacks/connect'; import { useState useEffect } from 'react'
notes: Complete wallet management with new connect() API and localStorage persistence

name: persist-wallet-connection
description: Save wallet connection state to localStorage
code: function saveWalletState(address network connected) { const state = { address network connected timestamp: Date.now() }; localStorage.setItem('stacks_wallet' JSON.stringify(state)) }; function loadWalletState() { const raw = localStorage.getItem('stacks_wallet'); if (!raw) return null; const state = JSON.parse(raw); const hourAgo = Date.now() - 3600000; if (state.timestamp < hourAgo) return null; return state }
notes: Includes timestamp expiry (1 hour); prevents stale connections

name: check-connection
description: Check if wallet is already connected
code: if (isConnected()) { console.log('Already authenticated'); return }
notes: Check connection status before calling connect(); prevents duplicate connection prompts

name: disconnect-button
description: Disconnect wallet with UI feedback and cleanup
code: function DisconnectButton({ onDisconnect }) { const handleDisconnect = async () => { const { disconnect } = await import('@stacks/connect'); await disconnect(); localStorage.removeItem('walletAddress'); localStorage.removeItem('stacks_wallet'); onDisconnect(); }; return <button onClick={handleDisconnect}>Disconnect</button> }
notes: Cleans up both localStorage and @stacks/connect session

name: format-wallet-address
code: function formatAddress(address maxLength = 12) { if (!address) return ''; if (address.length <= maxLength) return address; const start = Math.floor((maxLength - 3) / 2); const end = address.length - (maxLength - 3 - start); return `${address.slice(0 start)}...${address.slice(end)}` }
notes: Configurable truncation; default shows ~6 chars + ... + ~3 chars

name: connection-status-badge
code:
function ConnectionStatus({ connected }) { return
{connected ? 'Connected' : 'Disconnected'}
}
notes: Green dot for connected, red for disconnected; customizable styling

name: wallet-info-display
description: Complete wallet info display with balance
code:
function WalletInfo({ address }) { const [balance setBalance] = useState('0'); useEffect(() => { if (!address) return; fetch(`https://api.hiro.so/extended/v1/address/${address}/balances`).then(r => r.json()).then(data => setBalance((Number(data.stx.balance) / 1000000).toFixed(2))) }, [address]); return
{formatAddress(address)}
{balance} STX
}
notes: Fetches and displays STX balance; combines address display with balance
